Daemos:
Now I suppose you would have some use for me, or else you would not have 
summoned me here. I suggest that we start talking about business now...
I am transformed...

He transformed to his robot mode, standing on two wolf-like legs, four wings 
sprouting from his back and many spikes on his forearms. He was enjoying the 
fact that he had impressed Zardus and he was now eager to know what was the 
project the Alliance Leader had for him.


>From: Yanshosh@...
>Reply-To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: More Stuff :) / Najah
>Date: Sun, 01 Jul 2001 02:54:34 -0000
>
>::Zardus::
>
>"Yes, you can, Najah," Zardus replies to the snake as he changes 
>destination and walks toward the exit of the Iron Fist. He recieves the 
>Daemos's message as he exits the ship, seeing Daemos emerge and introduce 
>himself. He approaches, looking the bot over.
>
>"Very impressive," he says, walking past Supernova and his team. "I am 
>Zardus. Welcome to my base."
>
>He stops a few feet from Daemos, waiting for the reply, his mind already 
>calculating what he could use this mercenary for.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nicolas Marion" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Daemos received the welcome message from Zardus.
> >
> > Daemos:
> > Thank you, Zardus. And thank you too, Supernova. I must tell you, 
>though,
> > that I will show myself in my beast mode.
> > Hellgate, open lock.
> >
> > The Hellgate's doorlock opened and Daemos walked out. His body was that 
>of a
> > middle-sized red demon, but there was something else...
> > His spikes, running all over his back to his cranium, were metallic, and 
>his
> > legs were covered with circuitry. The claws of his hands were
> > disproportionned, seeming to be a lot larger than his body could 
>support.
> >
> > Daemos:
> > I am Daemos, first Tripredacus to be reformatted as a techno-organic
> > transformer.
> >
